remarks: For any complex number, there exists a unit-magnitude multiplier that produces its absolute value.  Part of proof of Theorem 13-2.12 of [Gleason] p. 195.  (Contributed by NM, 26-Mar-2005.)
statement:
abs1m $p |- ( A e. CC -> E. x e. CC ( ( abs ` x ) = 1 /\ ( abs ` A ) = ( x x. A ) ) ) $.
$d A x $.
